intro: Tamus communis var. triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed burr cucumber, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It features a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves that have three distinct lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into spiny, three-lobed fruits. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The species is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is sometimes considered a weed in woodland areas.
